title: JSON schema for any Grunt task

expand.description: Must be set to true to use properties other than 'src' and 'dest'

cwd.description: All 'src' matches are relative to (but don't include) this path

ext.description: Replace any existing extension with this value in generated 'dest' paths.

extDot.description: Used to indicate where the period indicating the extension is located.

filter.description: The 'filter' property can help you target files with a greater level of detail

flatten.description: Remove all path parts from generated 'dest' paths

matchBase.description: If set, patterns without slashes will be matched against the basename of the path if it contains slashes. For example, 'a?b' would match the path '/xyz/123/acb', but not '/xyz/acb/123'.

nonull.description: If set to 'true' then the operation will include non-matching patterns. Combined with grunt's '--verbose' flag, this option can help debug file path issues.

rename.description: This function is called for each matched 'src' file, (after extension renaming and flattening).

src.description: Pattern(s) to match, relative to the 'cwd'.
